ProjectTitle: The role of dynamic mechanical behavior of altered collagen network under loading to OA statedependent cartilage degradation: combined in vitro and in silico study
InitialFeedbackHistory:
15/04/2024
Personal data: The UK and the EU have different rules for when data is considered anonymous; if there is still a way to re-identify the participants, even when you need additional information that stays with your collaborators in the UK, your data is considered pseudonymous and a privacy assessment is needed at KU Leuven via PRET. see https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/researchers#section-8, 'Anonymisation / pseudonymisation'. and https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/studpers/index
Storage: storing data on laptops and external hard drives is not very secure, is there a specific reason to use these in addition to a KU Leuven storage solution with automatic backup? see https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en
Sharing: note that, when keeping data under access restrictions, you can't use a license but you need a data transfer agreement that the RDR team will write with you and the legal department when data is requested.
label: good with suggestions
